subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Thursday, 17 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Ranieri plays down Man City link
Claudio Ranieri says he has not been contacted about the Man City job, despite bookmakers making him firm favourite.



 
Whelan demands league chiefs quit
Wigan chairman Dave Whelan says Premier League chief executive Richard Scudamore should resign in the wake of the West Ham controversy.



 
Unsworth and De Zeeuw leave Wigan
Wigan release former captain Arjan de Zeeuw and fellow defender David Unsworth.








GOLF




Irish Open leaderboard
The latest scores from the European Tour event at Adare Manor.



 
Irish Open hit by lure of US Tour
Graeme McDowell says events such as this week's Irish Open are suffering because of the US Tour's strength.



 
Ballesteros set for senior debut
Seve Ballesteros will make his Champions Tour debut at the Regions Charity Classic in Birmingham, Alabama, on Friday.








MOTORSPORT




Hamilton won't win title - Jordan
Former team boss Eddie Jordan says Lewis Hamilton is an "extraordinary talent" but will not be world champion this year.



 
Nieto replaces Jacque at Le Mans
Kawasaki's Olivier Jacque will miss this weekend's French Grand Prix at Le Mans with an arm injury.



 
Hamilton will set 'new standards'
Lewis Hamilton will "create the new benchmark for Formula One", according to three-time champion Jackie Stewart.








FORMULA ONE




Hamilton won't win title - Jordan
Former team boss Eddie Jordan says Lewis Hamilton is an "extraordinary talent" but will not be world champion this year.



 
Hamilton will set 'new standards'
Lewis Hamilton will "create the new benchmark for Formula One", according to three-time champion Jackie Stewart.



 
Alonso plays down Hamilton threat
Fernando Alonso says he does not regard McLaren team-mate Lewis Hamilton as his biggest threat this season.








ATHLETICS




Kenya star denied Manchester visa
World half-marathon record holder Sammy Wanjiru will miss Sunday's Great Manchester Run after failing to obtain a visa.



 
Sprint stars set for Loughborough
Three of the British squad that won the Olympic 4x100m gold in 2004 will compete at the Loughborough International on Sunday.



 
Cheruiyot storms to Glasgow win
Vivian Cheruiyot wins the women's 10 kilometres road race in Glasgow.








CYCLING




Foerster races to Giro stage win
Robert Foerster wins stage five of the Giro d'Italia but Danilo Di Luca retains the overall lead.



 
Cavendish outlines Tour ambition
Britain's Mark Cavendish believes he is on course to one day challenge for sprint glory in the Tour de France.



 
Di Luca claims Giro d'Italia lead
Danilo Di Luca takes the overall lead in the Giro d'Italia after team-mate Enrico Gasparotto falls.








FUN AND GAMES




FA Cup final Ten to Tackle
Test your knowledge of the competititon  with our special quiz



 
Chris Evans talks to Vaughan and Stewart
Michael Vaughan arrives late for his Chris Evans interview then asks the DJ to bowl at him in the nets. Alec Stewart also gives his views on the Test series with West Indies. 

Evans and sidekick Jonny Saunders have a different sporting guest every evening on their Radio 2 show.



 
KP's rough guide to Britain
Listen to Pietersen spoof on new Radio 4 show Look Away Now
